article.bdy:
Dudley Lynch is an
American
author, publisher and educator who wrote Strategy of the Dolphin: Scoring a Win in a Chaotic World with co-author Paul L. Kordis.1 The work describes a thinking-skills model for businesspersons and others known as
The Strategy of the Dolphin
.2
Lynch is a primary creator of books and personal and organizational growth models and tools based on the “general systems” theory of developmental psychologist
Clare W. Graves
3 and other brain-function-related researchers. Founder in the early 1980s of Brain Technologies Corporation of Plano, Texas, he writes and teaches extensively, encouraging naturalistic-based approaches informed by contemporary science and philosophy for solving 21st Century problems.
His books have made bestseller lists in
France and
Germany and have been book club selections in the U.S. His and Kordis’s work, Der Schlüssel zur Globalierung. Handbuch für den Wandel (The Key to Globalization: A Handbook for Change), and
Marshall McLuhan ’s The Global Village were the initial works in Junfermann’s futuristic Medienanthropologie series.4
He has trained a wide network of consultancy professionals in his models, tools and methods. His books and assessment tools have been published in nine languages. His long-time interest in science writing—begun in the 1960s as a public affairs writer with the Los Alamos Scientific Laboratory5—continues with a weekly blog commentary on thinking and the brain.
Bibliography
Dudley Lynch, Your High-Performance Business Brain—An Operator’s Manual, Prentice-Hall, 1984
Dudley Lynch and Paul L. Kordis, Strategy of the Dolphin: Scoring a Win in a Chaotic World, William Morrow and Company, 1989
Dudley Lynch and Paul L. Kordis, Code of the Monarch: A Guide to the Real Global Business Revolution, Brain Technologies Press, 1990
Dudley Lynch and David Neenan, Evergreen: Playing a Continuous Comeback Business Game, New Echelon Press, 1995
Dudley Lynch, The Mother of All Minds: Leaping Free of an Outdated Human Nature, Brain Technologies Press, 2003
